summary: Rural tourism, categorized under social affairs within EU legal frameworks, encompasses various initiatives aimed at promoting sustainable economic development in rural areas. This concept is pivotal for enhancing local livelihoods, preserving cultural heritage, and fostering environmental sustainability. The EU supports rural tourism through regulatory measures and funding programs, encouraging diversification of rural economies and improving infrastructure. By integrating rural tourism into broader regional development strategies, the EU aims to mitigate urban migration and enhance social cohesion. Legal frameworks facilitate cooperation among stakeholders, ensuring that rural tourism initiatives align with EU objectives for sustainable development and social inclusion.
